subject: p15204620
History: Newly diagnosed small cell cancer and post-obstructive pneumonia.
Findings: There is no pneumothorax. A skin fold simulated that finding on yesterdays chest radiograph. Small regions of new consolidation in the right upper and left lower lobes have improved, perhaps these were areas of atelectasis or aspiration. The right middle lobe remains densely consolidated, and small right pleural effusion is stable. There is no appreciable left pleural effusion. There is extensive adenopathy in the right hilus and in the mediastinum extending through the thoracic inlet. Heart size normal. Current and prior findings were discussed by telephone with the patients clinical care team at the time of dictation.
